articles.title: Jim Cramer Finds Outperformance Of This ETF 'Pretty Amazing' — Here's Why It's Happening
articles.content:
Tech stocks have been on a tear this year following their underperformance in 2022 — and CNBC “Mad Money” host Jim Cramer  took to Twitter to laud the performance of one key exchange-traded fund related to the tech sector.
What Happened:  “The outperformance of the QQQs is pretty amazing,” Cramer tweeted Friday, referring to the Invesco QQQ Trust (NASDAQ: QQQ).
QQQ is an ETF that tracks the Nasdaq-100 Index, which includes Apple, Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL), Alphabet, Inc. (NASDAQ: GOOGL) (NASDAQ: GOOG) and Microsoft Corp. (NASDAQ: MSFT). These companies are at the forefront of transformative technologies, such as augmented reality, cloud computing, big data, mobile payments, streaming services, electric vehicles and more. Microsoft and Apple are the index’s top components, with weightings of 12.58% and 12.24%, respectively.
In the year to date, QQQ has gained about 14.7%, compared ...Full story available on Benzinga.com
